required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Exercise Training on Cardiovascular Health in Middle-aged Women
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Exercise Training on Cardiovascular Health in Middle-aged Women

brief_summary.textblock: The hypothesis of the present study is that physical training can oppose detrimental changes in cardiovascular and metabolic health associated with estrogen loss after menopause.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Measurements of leg blood flow by ultrasound doppler during exercise and during femoral arterial infusion of vasodilators

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Magnetic resonance imaging and transthoracic echocardiography

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Platelet aggregation assay of whole blood and platelet rich plasma

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of proteins in muscle samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Western Blot analysis of proteins of relevance for vascular function and metabolism

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal oxygen uptake during an incremental cycle ergometry test with gas analysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Genomic analysis of parameters for vascular and metabolic health

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Fasting plasma glucose analysis and oral glucose tolerance test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Gene expression of proteins in muscle samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Gene analysis of relevance for vascular and metabolic function

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma lipid status and other variables related to vascular health

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
other_outcome.description: Dual x-ray absorptiometry, height, weight, waist and hip circumference

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline comparison and changes from baseline to 3 months
other_outcome.description: Activity measure for one week by accelerometer

arm_group.description: The Premenopausal women are randomized to exercise by spinning (cycle)
The Postmenopausal women are randomized to exercise by spinning (cycle)

intervention.description: After the baseline studies the pre and postmenopausal women will be randomized to spinning training groups and the intervention will last for 3 months. The spinning group will spin three times per week under guidance of a trained instructor. The training is heart rate monitored.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Premenopausal (45-53 years) OR postmenopausal 50-57 years
- BMI> 18.5 and <30
- Sedentary (no regular physical activity the last 2 years)
- Plasma measurements
- Premenopausal: estradiol> 0.20 nmol/l, Follicle stimulating hormone < 22 IU/l and progesterone >2.5 nmol/l
- Postmenopausal: estradiol < 0.20 nmol/l, Follicle stimulating hormone > 22 IU/l and progesterone 0.3-2.5 nmol/l
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoking
- Excessive alcohol intake
- Regular medication including hormone replacement treatment
- Chronic disease
